@graph.title: Globalization and the Muslim world : culture, religion, and modernity
@graph.abstract: Civilizing others : global modernity and the local boundaries (French/German, Ottoman, and Arab) of Savagery / Birgit Schaebler -- Subduing globalization : the challenge of the indigenization movement / Mehrzad Boroujerdi -- Subjectivity, political evaluation, and Islamist trajectories / Sayres S. Rudy -- Islam in the West : modernity and globalization revisited / Jocelyne Cesari -- Islam, knowledge, and "the West" : the making of a global Islam / Leif Stenberg -- Globalization, migration, and identity : Sudan, 1800-2000 / Heather J. Sharkey -- Globalization and the Internet : the Malaysian experience / Toby E. Huff -- The global Mufti / Jakob Skovgaard-Petersen -- Where does globalization take place? : opportunities and limitations for female activists in Turkish Islamist non-governmental organizations / Catharina Raudvere -- From postmodernism to "glocalism" : toward theoretical understanding of contemporary Arab Muslim constructions of religious others / Patrice C. Brodeur -- The scandal of literalism in Hamas, the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, and beyond / Anne Marie Oliver
